page.title: 07UNLOADING GRAIN
page.content: It takes the barges six to eight hours to unload the grain.After the grain has been milled it is taken to all parts of the country by lorries. The river tends to suffer from Twentieth century debris washed in by the tides.The Anglian Water Authority are in the process of reinforcing the sea wall to protect the low lying surrounding areas from flooding. On the highest point of the area stands{St.Mary's and All Saints {Church.}Parts of this church were built between 1020 to 1040 and were standing when William of Normandy landed in 1066.Next to the church is {Stambridge School.}It was built in 1877 and today has 72 pupils and 3 full-time teachers plus three part-time teachers.
